Edited June 25, 2014 by AvronMullican

A few new ships

SNSS-Drift

a fighter armed with 4 AP rounds and powered by 4 ion engines

SNSS-Dreamer

a destroyer armed with 10 AP rounds and powered by 2 nuclear engines

SNSS-Nightmare

a light cruiser armed with 12 AP rounds and powered by one nuclear engine

SNSS-Waker

a cruiser armed with 16 AP rounds and powered by 4 nuclear engines

Edited June 25, 2014 by iamonfire

Or a good pilot with a tactic???

I don't disagree that good piloting and tactics are useful, but a VTOL allows you to hover near a hard-to-hit target and unload missiles on it with precision and stability.Just a suggestion.

Also, ya'll hear that 0.24 will get a 64 bit release? Heck yes!

Now we can hurl even more missiles at each other using even larger, more outlandish ships!

http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/newsfeed/000/641/298/448.jpg

I can't wait!

So I've been thinking about what to do with v1.

Now we can hurl even more missiles at each other using even larger, more outlandish ships!

P.S.: Hey BrightBritches, you got your post ready?

And my post will be up later tonight, real life and virtual life keep getting in the way (chores, errands, getting ready for a camping trip, defending a POS in EvE)

So I've been thinking about what to do with v1.

Hmm... that looks suspiciously like a Vanguard-Class.....

Looks fierce and tough to kill. Nice!
That's the one I'm scrapping. Part count(not really because of oncoming 64bit) and slow turning speed are issues.

How exactly did you build high explosive anti tank rounds in KSP?

And this is exactly why my Tanks are dominant in the food-chain

I'll give you a hint: Overheated parts. Explosive propulsion >

But the warheads themselves are so hard to correctly balance and compensate for gravity that my Panthers will be the only tank with a high enough profile to mount them. (Not too high tho)

Basically it allows you to launch an extremely long pointy projectile to pierce the toughest of armors.

//BATTLE ALERT!//

All units, be advised. MU forces are prepping to invade KSC!

Mechani Union vs. daeCorp

BATTLE OF KSC: Operation Kerbfall

Location: KSC, Island Airfield, and the ocean in and around that area.

Rules: Standard, plus:

1. Maximum of 11-13 units total.

2. Only 4 air units max.

3. 4 Ground per team. (MAX)

4. 3-4 Naval vessels per team. (The bigger a ship or all the ships are, the less are used. i.e., smaller ships can come in a group of 4.) (MAX)

5. Max. parts per air or naval vessel is 400 with ammunition loaded. (This may seem a bit generous, but some air units and naval vessels can suck up parts FAST.) Ground: 250 per unit.

Be reasonable, though.

6. K-Drive/"Slipstream Drive" propulsion is allowed for naval ships, but all other forms of Kraken-tech are prohibited. (We don't want to lose this battle to a Kraken! )

7. Special Rule: Transport Craft:

This rule allows for players to have "transports" that do not count as combatant craft. They are air or naval craft purely designed to ferry ground units across the ocean between KSC and the Island.

Players may spawn these craft IF NEED BE to ferry units, but must delete them from the persist once they complete their turn. They also must show that they used such a craft, and that it was unarmed.

However, these craft may not re-load ammo supplies of combatant craft, nor re-fuel them.

MU Marine Corps-Task Force Bravo TOTAL UNITS: 11

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The MU task force's ground units (save for one acting as AA for the island) are on the beaches of KSC already.

Prepare to defend yourself, daemon!

(Also, daecorp's spawn/base is KSC.)

Persist:

http://www./download/ie8por62tlw4g14/persistent(12).sfs

I was unaware you asked.

I could pose some up against some of my ships too.

No, just no.(unless it's a microfighter)
What should I aim for?
What kind of ship is it?
A capital ship, larger than a frigate.
3700 and up. But I still submit mine to spiritwolf. For combat in one SOI about 2.5k
